front.title: Distribution of Source Address Validation State in BGP

abstract.t: Source Address Validation (SAV) is a technique that can be used to mitigate source address spoofing. draft-huang-savnet-sav-table codifies the concept of source address validation on a per-incoming interface basis, the validation mode, and the traffic handling policy as a "SAV Table". This document defines a mechanism for distributing logical SAV Tables in BGP. This mechanism is addresses inter-domain SAV use cases. These SAV Tables may be used to implement appropriate device-specific validation for source addresses.
